main event: Multiple sightings of unidentified flying objects over Cleveland, Ohio in November 1957.
interesting points: The sightings included a circular silver object moving at a high rate of speed., One report described a round blue-grey object the size of a basketball observed making a clockwise motion for five minutes., The report suggested that the sightings were probably due to reflection of searchlights from Cleveland on registered clouds., Multiple witnesses reported seeing similar objects during this time., Different conclusions were drawn ranging from probable conventional aircraft to unexplained phenomena.
sighted object: one circular silver object, one round blue-grey object
witness description: one experienced intelligence officer, one unexperienced observer
